meanings.definition: Making a loud and confused noise.
meanings.sent1: The clamorous children were shouting and laughing in the playground.
meanings.sent2: The city streets were clamorous with honking cars and shouting pedestrians.
meanings.sent3: The clamorous birds outside my window woke me up early in the morning.
meanings.sent4: The clamorous thunderstorm drowned out all other sounds.
meanings.sent5: The clamorous alarm clock jolted me awake.

meanings.definition: Full of, marked by, or of the nature of clamor.
meanings.sent1: The clamorous protest filled the streets with chanting and signs.
meanings.sent2: The marketplace was clamorous with vendors calling out their wares.
meanings.sent3: The clamorous party next door kept me up all night with their music.
meanings.sent4: The clamorous debate in the courtroom echoed through the halls.
meanings.sent5: The clamorous fans cheered loudly for their favorite team.
